triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed by policy for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider requesting a higher deposit or reducing the loan amount to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for the applicant's credit tier. The current LTV is calculated as (Advance / Trade Price) * 100 = (41000 / 45000) * 100 = 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for Tier B applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy requirements.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A is 90%. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds the policy limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed by policy for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for Tier B applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds this limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed by policy for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider adjusting the loan terms or reducing the loan amount to lower the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 40% for Tier B applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 41.25%, which exceeds this limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for Tier A applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which is above the permissible limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or adjusting the term to lower the monthly payment and meet the DTI requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 45.63%, which is above the permissible limit.

content.reasoning: The proposal was evaluated against the underwriting policy, and two medium-severity issues were identified. The Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier, and the Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio also surpasses the policy limit. These findings suggest that the financial structure of the proposal does not fully align with the company's risk appetite.
